title: Ranil tipped to be next prime minister?
body_lines: Leader of United National Party (UNP) Ranil Wickremesinghe met with President Gotabaya Rajapaksa last evening (May 11), amidst speculations that the latter is tipped to be sworn in as the new prime minister of Sri Lanka.
According to political sources, the meeting lasted for nearly two hours at the President’s House in Colombo.

The premiership vacated by former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has been taken up for discussion at length. As per sources, an agreement has been reached during the meeting to appoint the UNP leader as the new prime minister.
The majority of parliamentarians have agreed to support MP Wickremesinghe for the premiership.

Meanwhile, it is reported that the group of parliamentarians who became independent in the House recently have decided to submit three nominations for the prime minister portfolio. They have reportedly proposed MPs Wijeyadasa Rajapakshe, Dullas Alahapperuma and Nimal Siripala de Silva for the post.
Meanwhile, Field Marshal MP Sarath Fonseka has stated that he would not be accepting any portfolios in the government headed by the incumbent President.
He made this remark via a statement published on his Facebook handle in response to the speculations about the premiership.
The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) parliamentarian also decried the attempts to mislead the public through false propaganda.
